page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Holmes Chapel, a growing village, began life round a church. Today many new estates lie to the west of London Road towards the M6 linking north and south. Expansion to the east is restricted due to Jodrell Bank radio telescope. The growing community of commuters in this area strains local services. Recent years have seen a new shopping precinct, a health centre, a library, a fire station, a leisure complex/comprehensive school and two primary schools. There are two established industries: Fisons Pharmaceuticals and Fine Arts wallpaper manufacturer. Many people travel out to work either by road or rail. Although rural land has been developed there is still a significant farming community. The River Dane valley is used for country pursuits.
